title: Senate Panel Scrutinizes Use of Texas Law to Shift Liabilities to Bankruptcy
sub_head: The Senate Judiciary Committee is examining the use of a Texas corporate law that has let Johnson & Johnson and other companies move mass injury lawsuits to bankruptcy court
body:
A Senate panel on Tuesday considered curbing chapter 11 filings that stem from a Texas law used by Johnson & Johnson and other companies to shift more than a quarter-million cancer lawsuits to bankruptcy court.
These companies are attempting to resolve mass asbestos-injury allegations through bankruptcy by using newly-created corporate affiliates, an emerging legal strategy that has drawn attention from the Senate Judiciary Committee dealing with the federal-court system.
